turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: For very long?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't see anyone for very long, Mr. Gittes.  It's difficult for me. Now I think you know all you need to about me. I didn't want publicity. I didn't want to go into any of this, then or now. Is this all?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: K... Cross.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That your maiden name?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes... why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No reason.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You must've had a reason to ask me that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No. I'm just a snoop.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You seem to have had a reason for every other question.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No, not for that one.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How did it happen?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Been meaning to talk to you about that.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Maybe putting your nose in other people's business?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: More like other people putting their business in my nose.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Another satisfied client?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Another satisfied client's wife.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh, no. I've got my own car. The creamcolored Packard.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Wait a minute, sonny.  I think you better come with me.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What for? There's nothing more to say.  Get my car, please.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Whoever's behind my husband's death, why have they gone to all this trouble?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Money. How they plan to make it by emptying the reservoirs, that I don't know.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'll pay your salary plus five thousand dollars if you find out what happened to Hollis and who is involved.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Your father is Julian Cross, isn't he?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, of course. It was quite a while after. I was just out of grade school when they did that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: So you married your father's business partner?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You've got one going, Mrs. Mulwray.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Is there something upsetting about my asking about your father?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No!... Yes, a little. You see Hollis and my fa... my father had a falling out...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Over the water department, or over you?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Not over me. Why would they have a falling out over me?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Then it was over the water department.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Not exactly. Well, I mean, yes. Yes and no.  Hollis felt the public should own the water but I don't think my father felt that way.  Actually, it was over the Van der Lip. The dam that broke.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes. He never forgave him for it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Never forgave him for what?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: For talking him into building it, he never forgave my father... They haven't spoken to this day.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You sure shout that?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Of course I'm sure.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What about you? Do you and your father get along?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Before this I turned on the faucet, it came out hot and cold, I didn't think there was a thing to it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That dam is a con job.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What dam?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: The one your husband opposed. They're conning L.A. into building it, only the water won't go to L.A. It'll go here.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: The Valley?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Everything you can see, everything around us. I was at the Hall of Records today.  That bother you?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: In the last three months, Robert Knox has bought 7,000 acres, Emma Dill 12,000 acres, Clarence Speer 5,000 acres, and Jasper Lamar Crabb 25,000 acres.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Jasper Lamar Crabb?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Know him?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No, I think I'd remember.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah. They've been blowing these farmers out of here and buying their land for peanuts. Have any idea what this land'll be worth with a steady water supply? About thirty million more than they paid.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And Hollis knew about it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It's why he was killed. Jasper Lamar Crabb. Jasper Lamar Crabb.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: We got it. We got it, baby.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What? What is it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There was a memorial service at the Mar Vista Inn today for Jasper Lamar Crabb. He died three weeks ago.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Is that unusual?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Two weeks ago he bought those 25,000 acres. That's unusual.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You're looking at the owners of a 50,000 acre empire.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: They can't be.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: They may not know it but they are.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'll stay.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Get in the car.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Maid's night off?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What do you mean, 'why?' Nobody's here, that's all.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I gave everybody the night off.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Easy, it's an innocent question.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No question from you is innocent, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I guess not to you, Mrs. Mulwray. Frankly you really saved my a... my neck tonight.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Tell me something. Does this usually happen to you, Mr. Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What's that, Mrs. Mulwray?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well, I'm only judging on the basis of one afternoon and an evening, but if that's how you go about your work, I'd say you're lucky to get through a whole day.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Actually this hasn't happened to me in some time.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: When was the last time?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Just. I don't know why. I'm asking.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It was in Chinatown.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What were you doing there?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Working for the District Attorney.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Doing what?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: As little as possible.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: The District Attorney gives his men advice like that?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: They do in Chinatown.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Boy oh boy, you're a mess.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: So why does it bother you to talk about it... Chinatown...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Bothers everybody who works there, but to me... It was...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Hold still. Why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You can't always tell what's going on there.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...No. Why was it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I thought I was keeping someone from being hurt and actually I ended up making sure they were hurt.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Could you do anything about it?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Your eye.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There's something black in the green part of your eye.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh that... It's a flaw in the iris...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: ...A flaw...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...Yes, sort of a birthmark...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Just... I have to.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: And I want to know where.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Please don't be angry... believe me, it's got nothing to do with you.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Please!... Trust me this much...  I'll be back. Look, there is something I should tell you. The fishing club that old lady mentioned, the pieces off the flag.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: The Albacore Club.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It has to do with my father.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He owns it. You know?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I saw him.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You saw my fa... father? When?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: This morning.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You didn't tell me.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There hasn't been a lot of time.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What did he say?  What did he say?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That you were jealous, and he was worried about what you might do.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Do? To who?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mulwray's girlfriend, for one thing. He wanted to know where she was.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I want you to listen to me. My father is a very dangerous man. You don't know how dangerous. You don't know how crazy.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Give me an example.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You may think you know what's going on, but you don't.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's what your father said. You're telling me he's in back of this whole thing?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's possible.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Including the death of your husband?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's possible. Please don't ask me any more questions now. Just wait, wait for me. I'll be back. I need you here.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Okay, give me the keys.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You bastard.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It's either that or you drive to the police yourself.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: The police?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: C'mon, Mrs. Mulwray. You've got your husband's girlfriend tied up in there!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: She's not tied up!

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You know what I mean. You're keeping her there against her will.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I am not!

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Then let's go talk to her.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: She's too upset.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What about?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Hollis' death. I tried to keep it from her, I didn't want her upset before I could make plans for her to leave.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You mean she just found out?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's not what it looks like, Mrs. Mulwray.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What does it look like?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Like she knows about Hollis' death. Like she knows more than you want her to tell.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You're insane.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Just tell me the truth. I'm not the police. I don't care what you've done. I'm not going to hurt you, but one way or another I'm going to know.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You won't go to the police if I tell you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I will if you don't.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I can't...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Because of Hollis? Because she was seeing your husband? Was that it? Jesus Christ, say something. Was that it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I took your husband's Buick...  I'll return it tomorrow.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Aren't you coming back with me?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Don't worry. I'm not telling anybody about this.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...That's not what I meant.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Did you get some sleep?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Did you have lunch? Kyo will fix you something.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where's the girl?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Upstairs. Why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I want to see her.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...she's having a bath now... why do you want to see her?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Going somewhere?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, we've got a 4:30 train to catch. Why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: J. J. Gittes for Lieutenant Escobar

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What are you doing? What's wrong? I told you we've got a 4:30.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You're going to miss your train!  Lou, meet me at 1412 Adelaide. It's above Santa Monica Canyon... yeah, soon as you can.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What did you do that for?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You know any good criminal lawyers?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Don't worry. I can recommend a couple. They're expensive but you can afford it.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What the hell is this all about?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I found these in your backyard... in your fish pond. They belonged to your husband, didn't they?... didn't they?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't know. I mean yes, probably.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yes positively. That's where he was drowned...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There's no time for you to be shocked by the truth, Mrs. Mulwray. The coroner's report proves he was killed in salt water. Just take my word for it. Now I want to know how it happened and why. I want to know before Escobar gets here because I want to hang onto my license.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about. This is the most insane... the craziest thing I ever...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Stop it!  I'll make it easy. You were jealous, you fought, he fell, hit his head. It was an accident, but his girl is a witness. You've had to pay her off. You don't have the stomach to harm her, but you've got the money to shut her up. Yes or no?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Who is she? And don't give me that crap about it being your sister. You don't have a sister.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's good. Now what's her name?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Katherine.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Katherine?... Katherine who?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: She's my daughter.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I said the truth!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: She's my sister.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I said I want the truth.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: She's my sister and my daughter!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...he had a breakdown... the dam broke... my mother died... he became a little boy... I was fifteen... he'd ask me what to eat for breakfast, what clothes to wear!... It happened... then I ran away...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: To Mexico...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Hollis came and took... care of me... after she was born... he said... he took care of her... I couldn't see her... I wanted to but I couldn't... I just want to see her once in a while... take care of her... that's all...  but I don't want her to know... I don't want her to know...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: ...so that's why you hate him...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah... where are you taking her now?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Back to Mexico.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You can't go by train. Escobar'll be looking for you everywhere.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How about a plane?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's worse... Just get out of here. Walk out, leave everything.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I have to go home and get my things.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Where can we go?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: ...where does Kyo live?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: With us.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: On his day off. Get the exact address.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He didn't wear bifocals.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Let me handle that.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sure, but I'd like to handle it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Walsh here?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: He's in the dark room.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sophie, go to the little girl's room for a minute.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: But, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sophie.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sophie.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Get me the Times. Whitey Mehrholtz.  And how about that snotty broad?  What does she think, she's perfect? Coming in waving her lawyers and her money at me  so goddam smug. She's no better than anybody else in this town.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where'd he go yesterday?

turns.speaker: WALSH'S VOICE
turns.text: Three reservoirs. Men's room of a Richfield gas station on Flower, and the Pig 'n Whistle.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Jesus Christ, this guy's really got water on the brain.

turns.speaker: WALSH'S VOICE
turns.text: What'd you expect? That's his job.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Listen, we can't string this broad out indefinitely we got to come up with something.

turns.speaker: WALSH'S VOICE
turns.text: I think I got something.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh yeah? You pick up the watch?

turns.speaker: WALSH'S VOICE
turns.text: It's on your desk. Say, you hear the one about the guy who goes to the North Pole with Admiral Byrd looking for penguins?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sophie... is Walsh there?... yeah, listen, pal, Escobar's going to try and book me in about five minutes... relax, I'll tell you. Wait in the office for two hours. If you don't hear from me, you and Duffy meet me at 1712 Alameda.

turns.speaker: WALSH'S VOICE
turns.text: Jesus, that's in Chinatown, ain't it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Hello, Miss Sessions. I don't believe we've had the pleasure.

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh yes we have... are you alone, Mr. Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Isn't everybody? What can I do for you, Miss Sessions?

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, I'm a working girl, Mr. Gittes. I didn't come in to see you on my own.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: When did you come in?

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: I was the one who pretended to be Mrs. Mulwray, remember?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Shut the fuck up!  ...Yes I remember nothing, Miss Sessions, just going over a detail or two with my associates... you were saying?

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: Well I never expected anything to happen like what happened to Mr. Mulwray, the point is if it ever comes out I want somebody to know I didn't know what would happen.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I understand... if you could tell me who employed you, Miss Sessions. That could help us both.

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: ...Why don't you give me your address and we can talk this over?

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: No, Mr. Gittes. Just look in the obituary column of today's Times...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: The obituary column?

turns.speaker: IDA'S VOICE
turns.text: You'll find one of those people.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: 'Those people?' Miss Sessions.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, Sophie.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE'S VOICE
turns.text: A Miss Sessions calling.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE'S VOICE
turns.text: Ida Sessions.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Don't know her. Take a number.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE'S VOICE
turns.text: Miss Ida Sessions again. She says you know her.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: Oh my goodness.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Nothing to do with Dad. It's me, actually.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Naturally, I want the best for him, money is no object.

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: Perhaps if we could meet your father.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There's just one question.

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Do you accept anyone of the Jewish persuasion?

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: I'm sorry. We don't.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Don't be sorry, neither does Dad. Wanted to make sure though, didn't we, honey?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Just to be certain, I wonder if you could show us a list of your patients?

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: We don't reveal the names of our guests as a matter of policy. I know you'd appreciate that if your father came to live with us.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's exactly what we wanted to hear.

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: Oh, good.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I wonder, is it too late for us to have a look around?

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: I don't think so. Be happy to show you.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Would you mind if we took a stroll on our own?

turns.speaker: PALMER
turns.text: Just, if you will, confine yourself to the main building. It's nearly bedtime.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: We understand, c'mon, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Can I help you?  Russ Yelburton, Deputy Chief in the Department.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: J.J. Gittes. And it's not a departmental matter.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: I wonder if you'd care to wait in my office?

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: After all, you work with a man for a certain length of time, you come to know him, his habits, his values, and so forth. Well either he's the kind who chases after women or he isn't.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: And Mulwray isn't?

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: He never even kids about it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Maybe he takes it very seriously.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You don't happen to know where Mr. Mulwray's having lunch?

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: I'm sorry, I --

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, tell him I'll be back.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mind if I take one of your cards? In case I want to get in touch with you again.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Help yourself.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Relax, Mulvihill, glad to see you.  Do you know Claude Mulvihill here?

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Hope so. He's working for us.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Mr. Gittes, sorry to keep you waiting. These staff meetings, they just go on and on.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, must be especially tough to take over under these circumstances.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Oh yes. Hollis was the best department head the city's ever had. My goodness, what happened to your nose?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I cut myself shaving.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: You ought to be more careful. That must really smart.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Only when I breathe.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Only when you breathe... don't tell me you're still working for Mrs. Mulwray?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I never was.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Neither do I, actually. But you hired me or you hired that chippie to hire me.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Mr. Gittes, you're not making a bit of sense.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, look at it this way, Mr. Yelburton.  Mulwray didn't want to build a dam and he had a reputation that was hard to get around, so. you decided to ruin it. Then he found out that you were dumping water every night. Then he was drowned.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Mr. Gittes! That's an outrageous accusation.  I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, Whitey Mehrholtz over at the Times will. Dumping thousands of gallons of water down the toilet in the middle of a drought.  That's news.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Wait. Please sit down, Mr. Gittes. We're... well, we're not anxious for this to get around, but we have been diverting a little water to irrigate avocado and walnut groves in the northwest valley. As you know, the farmers there have no legal right to our water, and since the drought we've had to cut them off. The city comes first, naturally.  But, well, we've been trying to help some of them out, keep them from going under. Naturally when you divert water you get a little runoff.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, a little runoff. Where are those orchards?

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: I said, the northwest valley.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's like saying they're in Arizona.

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Mr. Gittes, my field men are out and I can't give you an exact location...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You're a married man, am I right?

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Hard working, have a wife and kids...

turns.speaker: YELBURTON
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't want to nail you. I just want to know who put you up to it. I'll give you a few days to think it over.  Call me. I can help. Who knows? Maybe we can lay the whole thing off on a few big shots and you can stay head of the department for the next twenty years.

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: Mr. Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: Do you know me?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well... I think I... I would've remembered.

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: Have we ever met?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, no.

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: Never?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
turns.text: That's what I thought. You see, I'm Mrs. Evelyn Mulwray. You know, Mr. Mulwray's wife.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Speak English?... Habla Ingles?

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: Si.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Didn't you talk to a man here... few days ago... wore glasses... he...

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: The water.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What about the water?

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: When it comes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: When it comes? What'd you tell him?

turns.speaker: THE BOY
turns.text: Comes in different parts of the river. Every night a different part.

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: Jake, what're you doin' here?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Nothin', Morty, it's my lunch hour, I thought I'd drop by and see who died lately.

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: Yeah? Ain't that something? Middle of a drought, the water commissioner drowns. Only in L.A.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah. Banged up pretty bad.

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: That's a long fall.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: So how are you, Morty?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: Drowned, too.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: Yeah, got dead drunk, passed out in the bottom of the riverbed.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: The L.A. River?

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: Yeah, under Hollenbeck Bridge, what's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It's bone dry, Morty.

turns.speaker: MORTY
turns.text: It's not completely dry.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, well he ain't gonna drown in a damp riverbed either, I don't care how soused he was. That's like drowning in a teaspoon.

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: Gittes?... Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: Ida Sessions wants to see you.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah?... I do?

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: Sure you do.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, tell you what, pal. If Ida wants to see me she can call me at my office.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How do you do, Mrs. Mulwray?

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: Mr. Gittes...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Now, Mrs. Mulwray, what seems to be the problem?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No, really?

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: I'm afraid so.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I am sorry.

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: Can't we talk about this alone, Mr. Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'm afraid not, Mrs. Mulwray. These men are my operatives and at some point they're going to assist me. I can't do everything myself.

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Now, what makes you certain he is involved with someone?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray, do you love your husband?

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: ...Yes of course.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Then go home and forget about it.

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'm sure he loves you, too. You know the expression, let sleeping dogs lie? You're better off not knowing.

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: But I have to know.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: All right, what's your husband's first name?

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: Hollis. Hollis Mulwray.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Water and Power?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: This type of investigation can be hard on your pocketbook, Mrs. Mulwray. It takes time.

turns.speaker: MRS. MULWRAY
turns.text: Money doesn't matter to me, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: RAINMAKER
turns.text: No problem with me on the Job.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.  Do you have any references?

turns.speaker: RAINMAKER
turns.text: City of La Habra Heights filled an 800,000 gallon reservoir with sixteen inches of rain in two days.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's swell. But how about here?  Ever worked for Robert Knox, Emma Dill, Clarence Speer, Marian Parsons, or Jasper Lamar Crabb?

turns.speaker: RAINMAKER
turns.text: Never heard of 'em... new owners?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RAINMAKER
turns.text: Lot of turnover these days. Better tell them to get in touch with me if they want to hang onto their land.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, I'll do that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mr. Mulwray, please.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: He's not in, Mr.?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Gittes.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: May I ask what this is regarding?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It's personal. Has he been out long?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Since lunch.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Gee whiz.  And I'm late.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: He was expecting you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Fifteen minutes ago. Why don't I go in and wait?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Mr. Yelburton will be busy for some time.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well I'm on my lunch hour. I'll wait.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: He's liable to be tied up indefinitely.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I take a long lunch. All day sometimes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Julian Cross worked for the water department?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes. No.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: He did or he didn't?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: He owned it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: He owned the water department?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: He owned the entire water supply for the city?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How did they get it away from him?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Mr. Mulwray felt the public should own the display. The water. If you'll just read the display.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mulwray? I thought you said Cross owned the department.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Along with Mr. Mulwray.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: They were partners.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes. Yes, they were partners.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: This?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: They got into a terrific argument outside the Pig 'n Whistle.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What about?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: I don't know. The traffic was pretty loud. I only heard one thing  apple core.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Apple core?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Walsh. That's what you spent your day doing?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Look, you tell me to take pictures, I take pictures.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Let me explain something to you, Walsh. This business requires a certain finesse.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Look, Jake. She gave us Mulwray's real phone number and address.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: All she needed for that was the phone book!

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: No, no. She said not to call, her husband might answer.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: When I find out who that phony bitch was.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: So he says you sent them?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: They're all a bunch of phonies.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Think you can nail Mulvihill? They'll claim you were trespassing.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't want Mulvihill.  I want the big boys that are making the payoffs.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah. What's wrong with you guys? Think ahead. We find 'em, sue 'em. We'll make a killing.  We'll have dinner at Chasen's twice a week, we'll be pissing on ice the rest of our lives.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Sue people like that they're liable to be having dinner with the Judge who's trying the suit.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Duffy, go over and sit on Mulvihill.  Jesus Christ, I didn't tell you to bring the police department with you.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Jake, it's Chinatown. They're all over the place. You oughta know better.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Gimme your keys. Watch this old fart, will you?  Take Duffy's car. Curly's boat's in Pedro, near the Starkist cannery. It's the Evening Star. He'll be waiting. I'll take care of this.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What's that, pal?

turns.speaker: OTHER CUSTOMER
turns.text: Nothing. You got a hell of a way to make a living.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh? What do you do to make ends meet?

turns.speaker: OTHER CUSTOMER
turns.text: Mortgage Department, First National Bank.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Tell me, how many people a week do you foreclose on?

turns.speaker: OTHER CUSTOMER
turns.text: We don't publish a record in the paper, I can tell you that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Neither do I.

turns.speaker: OTHER CUSTOMER
turns.text: No, you have a press agent do it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: But that's what you told your wife.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Lots of fellas do. Tell the little woman they're going on a fishing trip, then shack up with some little twist on the island... she pretty?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'm going to see a man called Julian Cross. Ever heard of him?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Is the Pope Catholic? Who are you, mister?... I ask because he doesn't see a whole lot of people.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'm working for his daughter.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: That right?... She used to be some looker.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: She ain't exactly long in the tooth now.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: She must be about thirty-three, thirty- four.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You must be thinking of a different daughter.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: No, he's only got one, I remember her age, I read it in the newspapers when she ran away.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: She ran away?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Oh yeah, it was a big thing at the time. Julian Cross' daughter. God almighty. She was a wild little thing.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Course, she settled down nicely.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, you never know, do you?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: That's for sure.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Why'd she run away?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Oh, you know. She was sixteen or seventeen.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: We missed the best of it, didn't we, pal?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: She ran off to Mexico. Rumor was she was knocked up and didn't even know who the father was. Went there to get rid of it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You don't say?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Cross was looking for her all over the country. Offered rewards, everything. Felt real sorry for him, with all his money.
